channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Who is the Jan. 6 pipe bomb suspect? And, lawmakers see video of deadly boat strike
item.description: After a years-long investigation, the FBI has arrested a man accused of planting the Jan. 6 pipe bombs. And, lawmakers yesterday saw video of a deadly strike on an alleged drug boat in the Caribbean.
item.content:encoded:
After a years-long investigation, the FBI has arrested a man accused of planting the Jan. 6 pipe bombs. And, lawmakers yesterday saw video of a deadly strike on an alleged drug boat in the Caribbean.

(Image credit: Andrew Caballero-Reynolds)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: China in diplomatic push to isolate Japan in feud over Taiwan issue
item.description: No end in sight to spat between Japan and China over Taiwan, as neither Tokyo nor Beijing shows signs of backing down.
item.content:encoded:
No end in sight to spat between Japan and China over Taiwan, as neither Tokyo nor Beijing shows signs of backing down.

(Image credit: Eugene Hoshiko)
item.dc:creator: Anthony Kuhn

item.title: Who sued Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth this week? Find out in the quiz
item.description: This week, you'll need to be knowledgeable about holy media darlings, portrait-making techniques, and beloved Canadian icons — and that's just three questions.
item.content:encoded: This week, you'll need to be knowledgeable about holy media darlings, portrait-making techniques, and beloved Canadian icons — and that's just three questions.
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: The World Cup draw is here. Here's why it matters — and how it will work
item.description: FIFA is about to determine which teams all 48 participating countries in the FIFA World Cup 2026 will face in the group phase of the tournament, which the U.S., Canada and Mexico are co-hosting.
item.content:encoded:
FIFA is about to determine which teams all 48 participating countries in the FIFA World Cup 2026 will face in the group phase of the tournament, which the U.S., Canada and Mexico are co-hosting.

(Image credit: Fabrice Coffrini)
item.dc:creator: Rafael Nam

item.title: Traffic congestion hits a record high, spreading to more hours of the week
item.description: If it seems like traffic is getting worse where you live, that's because it probably is. After dropping during the COVID-19 pandemic, congestion climbed to record levels in 2024, researchers say.
item.content:encoded:
If it seems like traffic is getting worse where you live, that's because it probably is. After dropping during the COVID-19 pandemic, congestion climbed to record levels in 2024, researchers say.

(Image credit: Patrick T. Fallon)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: NPR battles Trump executive order in court
item.description: NPR was in court for a pivotal hearing arguing that the Trump administration had broken the law with its treatment of public media.
item.content:encoded:
NPR was in court for a pivotal hearing arguing that the Trump administration had broken the law with its treatment of public media.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Hegseth under fire amid new Signalgate report and boat strike briefing, the FBI arrests man they say planted pipe bombs near the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, SCOTUS allows Texas to use gerrymandered map.
item.content:encoded: Hegseth under fire amid new Signalgate report and boat strike briefing, the FBI arrests man they say planted pipe bombs near the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, SCOTUS allows Texas to use gerrymandered map.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: 'It was a miracle': Mom who had a stroke while pregnant reflects with her son
item.description: Marla Wendel was three months pregnant when she had a stroke. Over 30 years later, she talks with her now-adult son, Daniel, about the experience.
item.content:encoded: Marla Wendel was three months pregnant when she had a stroke. Over 30 years later, she talks with her now-adult son, Daniel, about the experience.
item.dc:creator: Jo Corona

item.title: At least 4 countries pull out of 2026 Eurovision contest over Israel's participation
item.description: Ireland, the Netherlands, Spain and Slovenia said they were pulling out of the contest after organizers decided to allow Israel to continue to compete, despite tensions over its conduct in Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
Ireland, the Netherlands, Spain and Slovenia said they were pulling out of the contest after organizers decided to allow Israel to continue to compete, despite tensions over its conduct in Gaza.

(Image credit: Martin Meissner)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Video shows Luigi Mangione says he didn't want to talk. Police kept asking questions
item.description: Before being read his rights, the suspect in the UnitedHealthcare CEO killing talked. Now his lawyers say those words could reshape the case.
item.content:encoded:
Before being read his rights, the suspect in the UnitedHealthcare CEO killing talked. Now his lawyers say those words could reshape the case.

(Image credit: Curtis Means)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
